title: Boy, 11, was target of Tuesday night shooting: NOPD
content:
The 11-year-old boy who was wounded in a Tuesday night shooting (Jan. 17) was the intended target of the gunfire, New Orleans police said.
A preliminary NOPD report says the boyfriend of the boy's sister drove a green convertible, possibly a Chrysler Sebring, to the 5100 block of Lakeview Court. He and the boy spoke, police said, and then an unnamed "subject fired shots at the victim, striking him."
The boy was taken by EMS to an area hospital for treatment.
A neighbor in the area said Tuesday night she heard at least five gunshots.
"It's common to hear shootings around here -- very common," another woman said, adding that she moved to the neighborhood just about a year ago. "It's a child now and that's very severe."
With this shooting, five juveniles have been wounded by gunfire this year in New Orleans.
Staff writer Laura McKnight contributed.
A boy was shot in the hip late Tuesday (Jan. 17) in the 5100 block of Lakeview Court, New Orleans police reported.
Correction: An earlier version of this story, based on a preliminary NOPD report, identified the sister's boyfriend as the suspected shooter. He was present during the shooting, but did not fire a weapon, police later said.
